©Strongwell Corporation




For nearly 15 years, the cooling tower market has been utilizing Strongwell pultruded fiberglass products.

In the last three to five years, pultruded FRP has become recognized as the best structural material for cooling tower construction. This recognition is due in part to:

  • Rising cost of traditional materials
    (i.e. wood, metal, concrete, etc.)
  • Design innovations
  • High strength / Lightweight
  • Corrosion resistance
  • Consolidation of parts
  • Ease of erection

Pultruded FRP is used in four basic types of cooling tower construction.

  • "Stick Built" Towers
  • Modular Towers
  • Reconstruction or Refurbishment of Existing Towers
  • "Shop Built" Cooling Towers

"Stick Built" Towers

"Stick Built" towers follow the existing wood designs using FRP components of similar size. Products used in this design are:

  • FRP Structural Shapes
    (i.e. angles, square tubes, round tubes, channels and plate)
  • SAFPLANK® and SAFDECK®
    (for use in the fan deck and hot water basin)
  • Fabricated ladders, walkways, platforms
  • FRP Grating
Go to the beginning of page

Modular Towers

Modular towers take advantage of FRP properties to achieve quick assembly with fewer parts. Typical of these designs are custom designed FRP shapes. Far quicker field erection can be achieved by utilizing custom designed parts and connections.
Although custom pultrusions are typically used as the structural members in this type of tower, standard FRP shapes as mentioned in the "stick built" option can be used in some tower designs.

Go to the beginning of page

Tower Reconstruction

In reconstruction of existing towers, FRP products replace wood as beams and columns. FRP parts can be made to the exact wood dimensions if necessary.
Also, standard Strongwell products, such as SAFPLANK®, are used in replacing traditional parts. Designing of FRP to wood connections is also an important consideration in tower renovation.

"Shop Built"

A "shop built" tower is a smaller tower that is factory assembled and shipped complete - ready for use by the customer. The market that primarily uses these types of towers is the HVAC market. Standard or custom shapes can be used in construction of this type of tower.

Strongwell is committed to growing this market with our standard and custom products, fabrication services and design expertise. The use of FRP in the cooling tower market is growing fast. Strongwell expects this market to continue to show rapid growth for many years!
